meanings.definition: A sentence in which the latter part does not logically follow from the first.
meanings.sent1: The anacolouthon confused the readers with its unexpected ending.
meanings.sent2: The anacolouthon in the story left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The anacolouthon at the end of the joke made it even funnier.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was like an anacolouthon, starting strong but ending abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The anacolouthon in the speech made it unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A rhetorical device in which a sentence is left unfinished or incomplete.
meanings.sent1: The speaker used an anacolouthon to create suspense.
meanings.sent2: The anacolouthon added a dramatic effect to the dialogue.
meanings.sent3: The anacolouthon in the play made the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: His writing style included an anacolouthon, leaving readers wanting more.
meanings.sent5: The anacolouthon in the poem emphasized the poet's creativity.
